column2: OREGON DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. This sign means:
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 2. Green and white signs:
column4: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column6: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column8: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 3. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column10: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 4. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column10: only on the left and right side

column2: 5. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column10: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 6. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column8: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

9. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.

column2: 10. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
11. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 12. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 13. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column8: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.

17. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column6: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column8: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 18. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column10: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column4: Immediately come to a complete stop

24. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: stay in the center of your lane
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 25. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: yield the right-of way to all vehicles that arrive after you.
column6: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.
column8: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column10: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.

column2: 26. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

31. Tailgating:
column4: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column8: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

column2: 32. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.

column2: 33. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
34. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column6: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column8: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column10: only if you have an emergency.

column2: 35. Never make a U-turn from:
column10: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
